definition: to stick up/to rise on one end/to tilt
surname Yao/Yao or Tang Yao (c. 2200 BC), one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], second son of Di Ku 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
to raise one's head and look
to hold one's breath (in anticipation) (idiom)/to anxiously await
see-saw/also written 蹺蹺板|跷跷板[qiao1 qiao1 ban3]
see-saw/also written 蹺蹺板|跷跷板[qiao1 qiao1 ban3]
Lin Chia-Chiao (1916-2013), Chinese-American physicist, astronomer and applied mathematician
to raise one's head and look into the distance/fig. to forward to/to long for
retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)
lit. on tiptoes/to look forward eagerly/to long for
(of a woman) to have nice curves/buxom/shapely

sentences.english: Curved at the point and inscribed with its mystical Arabic sentence.
sentences.chinese: 剑尖上翘，阴刻着神秘的阿拉伯铭文。

sentences.english: The special formulation of curliness make eyelash hold out for long time keep the curliness.
sentences.chinese: 独特的旋翘配方使睫毛持久保持旋翘。

sentences.english: But while the snub shape may be attractive, it is not necessary a blessing.
sentences.chinese: 尽管翘鼻子可能有魅力，但这未必是福。

sentences.english: Some planks are patched and warped. Several bottom skids are broken.
sentences.chinese: 一些板子补过并弯翘了，几根底梁断了。

sentences.english: Kerry was having a bad hair day, so she decided to wear a hat.
sentences.chinese: 凯芮今天头发乱翘，所以她决定要戴顶帽子。

sentences.english: After lunch, Kizuki suggested we skip classes and go play pool or something.
sentences.chinese: 用罢午餐，木月提议把课翘了，去打桌球或干点别的。

sentences.english: Breast stuck his bottom at the same time, it will certainly be accompanied by facial fullness.
sentences.chinese: 丰乳翘臀的同时，一定会随同这面部的丰满。

sentences.english: I know books. I have 186 of them at home.
sentences.chinese: 翘多嘛呆，我知道嘛是书，家里有百来本哩。

sentences.english: Aesthetic feeling is not enough, easy deformation.
sentences.chinese: 美观感不够，易曲翘变形。

sentences.english: My reason for cutting some classes could be accepted.
sentences.chinese: 我翘课的原因是可以接受的。

sentences.english: Your knees should be slightly bent and your hips slightly pushed back.
sentences.chinese: 膝盖应该微屈，臀部同时保持轻微的向后翘。

sentences.english: They were crowded together in a corner, their tails pointing the same way.
sentences.chinese: 它们在角落里挤成一团，尾巴翘向同一个方向。

sentences.english: Nose liked the idea of wintergreen candy.
sentences.chinese: 翘鼻子喜欢薄荷糖的主意。

sentences.english: I aced all my midterms and was yet to miss a class.
sentences.chinese: 我期中考试全拿了高分并且一次课都没翘过啊喂。

sentences.english: Its tail is also straight, not sticking up like a dog, and its ears are upright.
sentences.chinese: 它的尾巴是平直下垂的，不像狗的尾巴那样会向上翘。

sentences.english: Her upswept blond curls took her aunt two hours to fashion.
sentences.chinese: 而朝上翘的金色卷发则是她姑姑两个小时的工作成果。

definition: to stick up/to point sth up
to protrude/to stick out/to pout (also written 噘)/to embarrass (people)
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
one leg over the other (legs crossed)
slender waist/fig. pretty woman/mortise and tenon joint on a coffin
